tables.questionText: Which best describes the reason for having a drink in the past week?

rows.label: A way to feel closer to others and strengthen bonds
A way to demonstrate that you have good taste
A chance to try something new
A way to celebrate or mark a moment / achievement
An escape from stress or routine
A way to keep the night going
A way to honor customs, rituals, or family traditions

tables.questionText: You said your reason for having a drink in the past week was best described as [pipe: S10a lower]. More specifically, what best describes that moment?

rows.label: A drink to bring everyone together at the start of the night
Something to sip while catching up with close friends
A drink that feels appropriate for the situation makes me feel like I fit in at a social gathering
A go-to choice for reconnecting with someone after time apart
A drink that makes me feel confident and put-together in social settings
Something that looks elevated or premium when served
A drink that feels on-trend or buzzworthy
A drink I'd be proud to post or share on social media
A drink I've never tried before that sparks curiosity
Something with a surprising twist—flavor, format, or origin
A limited-edition or seasonal release I want to experience before it's gone
A drink that transports me somewhere new—culturally or emotionally
A drink to toast a personal win or milestone
Something festive to share when good news hits
A way to make an ordinary day or night feel a little more special
A drink I reach for when I just want what I want
A drink that feels rich, extra, or over-the-top—in the best way
A drink that feels like I'm treating myself
A drink to help me unwind after a long or stressful day
Something I reach for when I need a mental reset
A drink that helps me slow down and be present
A go-to when I want to escape the usual and feel transported
A drink that helps me feel confident and socially on-point for a night out
Something I choose when I want to bring my A-game to socialize
A go-to when I want to stay in control and keep the night flowing smoothly
A drink that's always part of our holiday or seasonal celebrations
Something I serve because it's what we've always had at family gatherings
A drink that helps keep a cultural or regional tradition alive
Something I choose because it reminds me of home or loved ones

changes: s1: labels - cleaned all row labels to match survey text and simplified wording (removed variable-prefixed label text).
s1: nets - added a multi-variable NET row '_NET_AnyIndustry' rolling up S1r1..S1r7 to show respondents in any listed industry.
s1: userNote - added (Select all that apply) and noted terminate behavior for options 1-3.
s6a: labels - Simplified and corrected each row label to match survey answer text (removed variable prefixes and long prompt text).
s6a: nets - Added a multi-variable NET row (_NET_S6a_Any) that aggregates any selection from S6ar1..S6ar8 (isNet=true, netComponents populated).
s6a: metadata - Filled surveySection, baseText, and userNote to document who was asked and response format.

s7: labels updated to match survey answer text; questionText replaced with verbatim survey text (removed variable prefix). Added userNote '(Select all that apply)'. No NETs created (multi-select binary flags).
s9: labels - Replaced verbose datamap labels with concise, survey-accurate location labels (e.g., 'At your home', 'At a craft cocktail bar', etc.).

s9: nets - Added On-premise (NET) and Off-premise (NET) mean_rows aggregations using exact component variables per survey mapping (On-premise = S9r5,S9r6,S9r7,S9r8,S9r9,S9r10,S9r11,S9r12,S9r13,S9r14,S9r16; Off-premise = S9r1,S9r2,S9r3,S9r4,S9r15).
s9: userNote/baseText - Added baseText clarifying who was asked (S8>0) and userNote about entering whole numbers and that location counts should sum to total drinks.
a7_1: labels - cleaned and shortened long autogenerated labels to match survey answer text (Cannabis / THC, Nicotine, Magic mushrooms, Caffeine, Other (specify), None of the above).
a7_1: nets - added multi-variable NET '_NET_A7_AnySubstance' that aggregates A7r1..A7r5 (Any of the substances).
a7_1: userNote - added '(Select all that apply)'.
a7_1: surveySection/baseText - set survey section to OCCASION LOOP and added baseText describing who was asked.
a9_1: labels - simplified long, repeated descriptive labels to the short answer text from the survey (e.g., 'I was alone', 'My friend(s)').
a9_1: nets - added a multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyCompanion' combining A9r2..A9r7 to show presence of any companion (isNet=true and netComponents populated).
a9_1: structure - indented companion component rows under the NET for visual hierarchy; kept 'I was alone' as a top-level, mutually-exclusive option.
a9_1: metadata - populated surveySection as 'OCCASION LOOP', added userNote '(Select all that apply)' and context in baseText.
a13b_1: labels - cleaned and shortened long pipe text into clear option labels (e.g., 'Beer', 'Wine', 'Canned cocktails / RTD', etc.).
a13b_1: nets - added a multi-variable NET row '_NET_AnyOtherDrinks' aggregating A13br1..A13br5 (isNet:true, netComponents populated).
a13b_1: userNote - added '(Select all that apply)' to clarify multi-select nature.
a13b_1: surveySection/baseText - set survey section to OCCASION LOOP and documented who was asked (loop context).
labels: Cleaned up long pipe-based labels to match survey answer text (shortened and removed pipeline tokens).
nets: Added a multi-variable NET row (_NET_A16_Any) that aggregates any selected reason (netComponents populated with the 10 binary variables).
userNote: Added '(Select all that apply)' to clarify response format.
surveySection: Set to OCCASION LOOP based on survey (Section A).
isDerived: Marked true because a synthetic NET row was added.
a17_1: labels - Simplified and matched labels to survey text; removed pipe placeholders and shortened where repetitive.
a17_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET row (_NET_AnyA17) for 'Any reason (NET)' combining A17r1..A17r9 with netComponents populated.
a17_1: structure - Indented component binary flags under the NET row and added user note indicating multi-select.
a19_1: labels - Cleaned and shortened component labels to match survey wording; removed pipe placeholders and duplicated question text from each label.
a19_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET row (_NET_A19_AnyReason) that aggregates all positive reason flags (A19r1..A19r11). Excluded 'None of the above' from the NET.
a19_1: structure - Indented component rows under the NET for visual hierarchy and left 'None of the above' as a separate top-level row.
a19_1: metadata - Populated surveySection as OCCASION LOOP; added baseText to indicate this was asked of respondents who purchased the drink; added userNote to indicate select-all.
a21: labels - Replaced generic / code-heavy labels with the exact answer text from the questionnaire (e.g., "A21r1: Tito's Handmade Vodka - ..." → "Tito's Handmade Vodka").
a21: nets - Added a multi-variable NET row (_NET_AnyBrand) aggregating awareness of any listed brand (A21r1–A21r6). netComponents populated accordingly.
a21: structure - Indented individual brand rows under the NET for visual hierarchy. Left 'None of the above' as a standalone top-level row (not part of NET).
a21: userNote - Added '(Select all that apply)' to clarify multi-select format.
a21: metadata - Set surveySection to 'OCCASION LOOP' per survey structure and marked table as derived because a NET was added.

a22: split - Converted wide A22 matrix into 10 attribute-level derived tables (one per attribute). Cleaned row labels to brand names and 'None of the above'; preserved variables and filterValue=1 for binary flags. Added context (baseText and userNote).
a22: exclude - Original flat overview table should be moved to reference/output sheet if desired; primary publication uses the derived attribute-level tables.
a23_tito_s_handmade_vodka: labels - Replaced generic labels with survey verbatim labels and clarified header wording (questionText updated to full question).
a23_tito_s_handmade_vodka: t2b - Added Top 2 Box (T2B) rollup (filterValue: '4,5') with component rows for 5 and 4.
a23_tito_s_handmade_vodka: nets - Added Bottom 2 Box (B2B) rollup (filterValue: '1,2') with component rows for 2 and 1.

a23_tito_s_handmade_vodka: metadata - Populated surveySection as 'OCCASION LOOP', added baseText noting respondents were those aware of the brand (A21), userNote describing scale, and tableSubtitle naming the brand. Marked table as derived (isDerived=true).
a23_grey_goose: labels - Expanded question text and updated row labels to match survey scale wording.
a23_grey_goose: t2b - Added Top 2 Box rollup (4,5) with component rows indented beneath it.
a23_grey_goose: nets - Added Bottom 2 Box rollup (1,2) with component rows indented beneath it.
a23_grey_goose: split - Treated as a brand-specific split (Grey Goose) and set tableSubtitle and baseText accordingly.
a23_ketel_one: labels - Updated questionText to full survey wording and clarified row labels to match scale labels.
a23_ketel_one: t2b - Added Top 2 Box (4,5) rollup with component rows indented.
a23_ketel_one: nets - Added Bottom 2 Box (1,2) rollup with component rows indented.
a23_ketel_one: split - Treated as a brand-specific split (Ketel One) and added tableSubtitle and baseText to reflect that.
a23_maker_s_mark: labels - Updated questionText to full survey wording and clarified row labels (Top 2 Box / Bottom 2 Box).
a23_maker_s_mark: t2b - Added Top 2 Box (4,5) rollup and Bottom 2 Box (1,2) rollup with component rows indented beneath each NET.
a23_maker_s_mark: split - Kept as a split-per-brand table and added tableSubtitle 'Maker's Mark'.
a23_casamigos: labels - Updated question text to full verbatim question and cleaned scale label for the neutral option.
a23_casamigos: t2b - Added Top 2 Box rollup (4,5) with component rows for 5 and 4 (indented).
a23_casamigos: nets - Added Bottom 2 Box rollup (1,2) with component rows for 2 and 1 (indented).
a23_casamigos: metadata - Populated surveySection as 'OCCASION LOOP', baseText to indicate this is shown only for brands selected in A21, userNote to clarify scale, and tableSubtitle 'Casamigos'.
a23_don_julio: labels - Updated questionText to full verbatim question for clarity and clarified labels to match survey scale language.
a23_don_julio: t2b - Added Top 2 Box (T2B) row (filterValue: 4,5) and Bottom 2 Box (B2B) row (filterValue: 1,2) with component rows indented beneath each NET for detail.
a23_don_julio: split - Treated as a split (Don Julio) and added tableSubtitle and userNote to reflect that this is the per-brand split.
c3: labels - cleaned row labels to match survey text and shortened verbose datamap descriptions
c3: nets - added multi-variable NETs for 'Employed (NET)' (C3r2,C3r3,C3r4) and 'Out of work (NET)' (C3r6,C3r7); set isDerived=true
c3: formatting - set questionText to survey verbatim and added user note '(Select all that apply)'
s2: labels — Updated questionText to remove numbering and made row label clear ('What is your age? (years)'); preserved mean_rows (summary stats are generated downstream).
s2: derived — Added a derived frequency table (s2_bins) with sensible age bins matching census-style groups (21-24,25-34,35-44,45-54,55-64,65-74) to provide a binned distribution for analysts.
s2: no_change — Did not exclude; variable is valid and within survey screening (ages 21-74).

s3: labels — Confirmed and kept labels matching survey; formatted questionText to remove question number prefix and added userNote '(Single select)'. No NETs or rollups added (categorical single-select; NET would be trivial).
s3: no_change — Table remains a simple frequency with four response rows; surveySection set to SCREENER.
s5: Found in survey (S5 income question). Action: Updated all row labels to match survey wording and full dollar ranges.

s5: Added three meaningful NET rows: 'Under $50k (NET)' (1,2), 'Middle income (NET)' (3,4,5), and 'Upper income (NET)' (6,7,8,9) to help analytical grouping. Components are presented directly beneath their NETs (indented).
s5: Marked surveySection as DEMOGRAPHICS AND PROFILING and added userNote '(Select one)'. No exclusion applied.
s6: labels - Confirmed labels match survey ('Yes' / 'No').

s10a: labels updated to match survey verbatim (expanded option 8 to include the full phrasing 'rituals, or family traditions'); removed question prefix from questionText; added userNote '(Select one)'. No NETs or rollups created because this is a single-select categorical question.
s10a: kept as a single readable frequency table (8 rows).
s10b: labels - Verified and updated labels to match survey verbatim (used datamap where needed).

s10b: grouping - Created category header rows to mirror survey subcategory headings (Connection/Belonging, Status/Image, Exploration/Discovery, Celebration, Indulgence/Personal Treat, Escape/Relief, Performance, Tradition, Other) and indented component rows beneath them to improve readability.
s10b: no_nets - No NET rows or T2B applied (categorical single-select).

s11a: labels - Verified and updated option 8 to match survey wording ('A way to honor customs, rituals, or family traditions'). Confirmed this is a single-select categorical question; no scale rollups (T2B) or NETs added. Minor label normalization for clarity. (Action: labels)

s11b: Labels normalized to match survey/datamap wording where helpful (minor clarifications for scannability).

s11b: Marked table as not derived, not excluded.

s11c: labels - Removed question-number prefix from question text; corrected/clarified answer label for option 4 to match survey wording (added full parenthetical). a2: Found in survey (SECTION A: OCCASION LOOP). Type: Categorical (time-of-day). Action: Added two meaningful NET rows — 'Daytime (Total)' (1,2,3) and 'Evening / Night (Total)' (4,5,6,7) — and indented component rows beneath each NET for readability. Question text slightly clarified to include the loop location placeholder. No rows excluded.
a2: Readability: Original 7 rows expanded to 9 rows including 2 NETs; still compact and scannable.
a3: labels - Verified and slightly clarified question text for context (appended reminder about 'selected location').

a4: labels - cleaned and expanded truncated labels to match survey wording (e.g., Hard Seltzer, RTD).
a4: nets - added two meaningful NET rows: 'Beer / Cider / RTD (NET)' (1,2,5,6) and 'Spirits (Total) (NET)' (7-14) with component rows indented beneath each NET for readability.

a5: labels - Fixed and expanded the first label (closed parenthesis and included the full explanatory text from the survey/datamap).
a5: surveySection/baseText/userNote - Added section (OCCASION LOOP) and base text noting this question is asked only when A4 is a spirits/liquor category.
a6: labels - Cleaned question text and tightened answer wording (e.g., 'A friend/family member' → 'A friend or family member'; 'Other' → 'Other (specify)')
a6: userNote - Added '(Select all that apply)' because question wording implies multi-select
a6: surveySection/baseText - Mapped question to SECTION A (OCCASION LOOP) and noted that it is asked about a specific recent drink (location-specific)
a6: no_change - No NETs or box-score rollups added (not a scale and no obvious meaningful NET; single variable with discrete options)

a10: labels - simplified the question label to 'Number of people (including yourself)' and ensured mean_rows structure retained (filterValue empty as required for mean_rows).
a10: baseText/userNote - added baseText noting this was asked only when respondent was not alone (A9 != 'I was alone') and user note clarifying valid whole-number range (2–30).

a10_dist_bins: derived - created a derived frequency table with sensible bins (2; 3-4; 5-6; 7-10; 11-30) to give analysts a readable distribution view. Marked as isDerived=true and kept sourceTableId=a10.
Readability: split into original mean_rows (for automatic summary stats downstream) plus a compact binned frequency table so both mean and distribution are available and each table is scannable.

a11: Found in survey (A11 in SECTION A: OCCASION LOOP). Identified as a 5-point satisfaction scale. Updated labels to match survey/datamap and added box-score rollups: Top 2 Box (4,5) and Bottom 2 Box (1,2). Reordered rows for readability and added user note. Action: labels, t2b.
No exclusion - question is substantive and varies.
